intro: Ceratotheca melanosperma, commonly known as the black-seed false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, palmately lobed leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule containing dark, elliptical seeds. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
